awd_titl_txt: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2021 and 2022 International Conference on Mobile Computing and Networking (ACM MobiCom)
awd_abstract_narration:
The 27th Annual International Conference on Mobile Computing and Networking (ACM MobiCom 2021) will be held from Jan. 31, 2022 through Feb. 4, 2022 in New Orleans, Louisiana, and the 28th Annual International Conference on Mobile Computing and Networking (ACM MobiCom 2022).  MobiCom is dedicated to addressing the challenges of mobile computing and networking and has emerged as one of the leading conferences covering networks, systems, algorithms, and applications that support the convergence of mobile computers and wireless networks. MobiCom attracts world-leading researchers and practitioners to attend and present their work and participate in panels and keynote sessions. In addition to the regular conference program, MobiCom 2021 and 2022 will include a set of workshops, panels, research demonstrations, and a poster session that includes the ACM Student Research Competition (SRC).  

The NSF travel grant will encourage more students to attend the conference and avail the benefits of interacting with leading researchers in the areas of mobile computing and networking and get motivated by the high-quality research work and discussions in the conference. The travel grant program has a proven record of providing minority and underrepresented students the means to benefit from this educational experience. Participation in MobiCom is an extremely important part of the graduate school experience, provides students with an opportunity to interact with more senior researchers, and exposes them to leading-edge research in the field.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
This award supported the travel of 19 students to the 2021 Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) Annual International Conference on Mobile Computing and Networking (MOBICOM) conference, which was held in New Orleans from March 28 to April 1, 2022. MobiCom is dedicated to addressing the challenges of mobile computing and networking, and has emerged as one of the leading conferences covering networks, systems, algorithms, and applications that support the convergence of mobile computers and wireless networks. The conference regularly attracts world-leading researchers and practitioners to attend and present their work and attend panels and keynote sessions.

By supporting the travel of students who would be otherwise unable to attend the conference, this award promoted the development of young researchers in the MOBICOM community and furthered their education. 8 recipients were members of underrepresented groups in computer science, and 15 recipients were first-time attendees of MOBICOM. This was the first MobiCom to be held in person after th COVID-19 pandemic, and participants were given the option of virtual attendance or deferral due to public health concerns. The recipients attended paper and poster presentations as well as social events, allowing them to see what a conference presentation looks like, to learn more about current mobile systems research, and to network with more established members of the community.
